title: Four killed in attack on U.S. Embassy convoy in Nigeria
description: The convoy was carrying nine Nigerian nationals: five U.S. Mission employees and four Nigeria Police Force members, the State Department said.

title: Suspected deadly fungal infections linked to surgery in Mexico
description: The CDC issued a health advisory and a travel advisory after five women developed meningitis following surgical procedures in the border city of Matamoros.

title: Three protesters face death in Iran, in year of more than 200 executions
description: Tehran is using capital punishment to crack down on and deter dissent, rights groups say, amid a spate of executions in 2023.

title: Russian scientists, experts in hypersonic technology, arrested for treason
description: In an open letter published on Monday, Russian scientists protested the academics’ arrest,

title: Abortion pill at heart of Supreme Court ruling is approved in over 90 countries
description: Legal wrangling over abortion and mifepristone — most recently in a federal appeals court — places the U.S. on a different trajectory from the rest of the world.

title: Ukraine says Patriot air defense system not destroyed
description: Moscow claimed to destroy one of two sophisticated Patriot air defense systems in Ukraine but Kyiv disputed the account. A U.S. official said one system was damaged but operational.

title: Diana’s deadly crash echoes in Harry and Meghan’s paparazzi ‘car chase’
description: The last day of Princess Diana’s life in 1997 began with romance and ended in tragedy — one reverberating after Harry and Meghan’s “near catastrophic car chase” with paparazzi this week.

title: Sudan’s warring factions target doctors and activists
description: Both the military and the paramilitary Rapid Support Force have repeatedly publicly pledged to respect cease-fires or humanitarian law only to break those promises within minutes.

title: A hippo charged a canoe, killing a baby. How dangerous are hippo encounters?
description: The boat that was capsized in Malawi’s Shire River has also left 23 people missing. Hippos are popular animals, but they have also been described as one of the world’s deadliest mammals.

title: Ecuador’s Guillermo Lasso dissolves congress, avoiding impeachment
description: The move by Lasso could mark the beginning of the end for one of the few remaining conservative heads of state in South America.

title: Ex-French president Sarkozy loses corruption appeal, must wear ankle monitor
description: Nicolas Sarkozy was convicted in 2021 of trying to bribe a judge, a decision upheld Wednesday. It's unlikely the former leader will ever be sent to prison.

title: Nine books that have been taken off library shelves in Hong Kong
description: Ahead of the anniversary of the 1989 Tiananmen Square massacre, authorities in Hong Kong are removing books that China deems sensitive from library shelves.

title: In canceling Pacific trip, Biden shows the U.S. has higher priorities
description: Detractors seeking to undermine U.S. influence in the region will seize on the president's decision to scrap plans to meet Pacific island leaders in Papua New Guinea.

title: Turkish opposition, trailing Erdogan, faces hard post-election truths
description: On the streets of Istanbul, and in opposition party headquarters across Turkey, supporters of Kemal Kilicdaroglu despaired about their chances of defeating Erdogan.

title: As G-7 approaches, Japan remains an outlier on LGBTQ rights
description: Japanese lawmakers have introduced a watered-down bill that would merely “promote the understanding” of LGBTQ communities, with no additional legal protection.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Zelensky renews plea for air defenses after Russian attack damages Patriot system
description: A U.S.-made air defense system was hit in a Russian attack. Ukraine shot down 18 missiles over Kyiv, but the whole country needs protection, Zelensky noted.

title: Thailand’s youth reject the generals
description: Sunday’s Thai election marked a rare moment in global politics when a suppressed protest movement found vengeance at the ballot box.

title: In photos: The scene of flooding in parts of northern Italy after days of downpours
description: Rivers swollen by downpours flooded some towns in northern Italy on Tuesday, forcing some residents to rooftops, while in Venice, authorities prepared to activate a mobile barrier in the lagoon in hopes of sparing the city from a rare May high-tide flooding.
